data.name: Hippopotas

attacks.name: Nose Jet
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It enshrouds itself with sand to protect itself from germs. It does not enjoy getting wet.

data.name: Dragonite-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Bust In
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench, you may move any number of basic Energy attached to your Pokémon to this Pokémon. If you do, switch this Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Jet Sonic
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Black Belt
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

You may use this card only if you have more Prize cards left than your opponent. During this turn, each of your Active Pokémon's attacks does 40 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Star Boomerang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, return Misty's Staryu and all cards attached to it to your hand. (Either way, this attack does its damage.)

data.name: Old Amber
rules: Play Old Amber as if it were a Colorless Basic Pokémon. (Old Amber counts as a Trainer card as well, but if Old Amber is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokémon.) Old Amber can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Old Amber from play. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Hard Amber
abilities.text: As long as Old Amber is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to Old Amber by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

data.name: Raticate

attacks.name: Transfer Junk
attacks.text: Put a Team Plasma Pokémon, a Team Plasma Trainer card, and a Team Plasma Energy card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.flavorText: With its long fangs, this surprisingly violent Pokémon can gnaw away even thick concrete with ease.

data.name: Absol

abilities.name: Dark Ambition

data.flavorText: Although it's said to bring disaster, in actuality, this Pokémon possesses a calm disposition and warns people of any crises that loom.

attacks.name: Tail Shake
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.flavorText: As powerful as an excavator, its ears can reduce dense bedrock to rubble. When it's finished digging, it lounges lazily.

data.name: Lotad

attacks.text: If Lotad has less Energy attached to it than the Defending Pokémon, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It looks like an aquatic plant and serves as a ferry to Pokémon that can't swim.

data.flavorText: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It submerges itself in sand and moves as if swimming. This wise behavior keeps its enemies from finding it and maintains its temperature.

data.name: Wally's Training
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Search your deck for a card that evolves from your Active Pokémon (choose 1 if there are 2) and put it on your Active Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Mom's Kindness
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Draw 2 cards.

rules: Damage done by attacks to the Pokémon that Metal Energy attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal. Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

data.name: Phoebe's Stadium

Each player pays ColorlessColorless less to retreat his or her Psychic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Smog

data.flavorText: Born in the spout of a volcano, its body is covered by flames that shimmer like the sun.

data.name: Old Amber
rules: Play Old Amber as if it were a Colorless Basic Pokémon. (Old Amber counts as a Trainer card as well, but if Old Amber is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokémon.) Old Amber can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Old Amber from play. rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to the Pokémon this card is attached to, heal 20 damage from it.

data.name: Pokémon Reversal
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

data.flavorText: Its movements are powered by a mysterious energy. It has continued to move since ancient times, so its power may soon run out.

rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Primal Vibes

attacks.name: Eerie Light
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Sharpedo-EX

data.name: Porygon

attacks.name: Calculate
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order.

data.flavorText: The world's first artificially created Pokémon. It can travel through electronic space.

data.name: Indigo Plateau
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
Each Pokémon LEGEND in play (both yours and your opponent's) gets +30 HP.

data.name: Sableye

abilities.name: Excavate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top card of your deck. You may discard that card.

attacks.name: Disable
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon is feared. When its gemstone eyes begin to glow with a sinister shine, it's believed that Sableye will steal people's spirits away.

data.name: Pow! Hand Extension
rules: You may use this card only if you have more Prize cards left than your opponent.

Move 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon. Or, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

attacks.name: Spirit Compressor
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 4 Pokémon and discard them. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Nightmare

attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon isn't Asleep, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Thanks to its unstable genetic makeup, this special Pokémon conceals many different possible evolutions.

attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left and Registeel Star is the only Pokémon you have in play, put 6 damage counters instead.

data.flavorText: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.

abilities.text: As long as Ampharos ex is in play, whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card to his or her Pokémon from hand, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon. You can't put more than 1 damage counter even if there is more than 1 Ampharos ex in play.

data.name: Rocket's Admin.
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck. Then, each player counts his or her Prize cards left and draws up to that many cards. (You draw your cards first.)

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.text: Discard a Water Energy card attached to Staryu and remove 4 damage counters from Staryu (all if there are less than 4).

data.name: Mr. Stone's Project
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. Or, search your discard pile for up to 2 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

data.name: White Kyurem

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flare Blizzard
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Flare Blizzard during your next turn.

data.flavorText: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

data.name: Steelix

attacks.name: Tail Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: It chews its way through boulders with its sturdy jaws. Its eyes can see in the darkness underground.

data.name: Revive
rules: Put a Basic Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Psyscan
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

data.name: Professor Elm's Training Method
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Search your deck for an Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Staravia

attacks.name: Double Peck
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Air Crash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Recognizing their own weakness, they always live in a group. When alone, a Staravia cries noisily.

data.name: Fisherman
rules: Put 4 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Double Rainbow Energy
rules: Double Rainbow Energy can be attached only to an Evolved Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex). While in play, Double Rainbow Energy provides every type of Energy but provides 2 Energy at a time. (Has no effect other than providing Energy.) Damage done to your opponent's Pokémon by the Pokémon Double Rainbow Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance). When the Pokémon Double Rainbow Energy is attached to is no longer an Evolved Pokémon, discard Double Rainbow Energy.

data.name: Liepard

attacks.name: Tail Trickery
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Assist
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your Benched Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

data.flavorText: Their beautiful form comes from the muscles they have developed. They run silently in the night.

data.name: Sinistea

attacks.name: Furtive Drop
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon is said to have been born when a lonely spirit possessed a cold, leftover cup of tea.

data.name: Unown [V]
rules: You may have up to 4 Basic Pokémon cards in your deck with Unown in their names.

abilities.name: [Vanish]
abilities.text: When you play Unown [V] from your hand, you may flip a coin. If heads, return 1 of your Pokémon with Unown in its name (other than Unown [V]) to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to that card.)

data.flavorText: It is believed that the variety of types of this Pokémon were created by evolutionary adaptation, as each possesses a different ability.

data.name: Skrelp

attacks.name: Poison Breath
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It vanishes into seaweed and remains perfectly still to avoid attacks from large Pokémon. Rotten seaweed is its main food source.

attacks.name: Wail
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Blissey

attacks.name: Tender Vengeance
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on each of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Charge Dash
attacks.text: You may do 20 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: The eggs it lays are filled with happiness. Eating even one bite will bring a smile to anyone.

data.name: Alolan Dugtrio

abilities.name: Tangling Hair
abilities.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost is Colorless more.

attacks.name: Dig Under
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.flavorText: Its shining gold hair provides it with protection. It's reputed that keeping any of its fallen hairs will bring bad luck.

data.name: Zoroark

attacks.name: Taunt
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Night Punishment
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile. You can't do more than 200 damage in this way.

data.flavorText: Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.

data.name: Aaron's Collection
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Search your discard pile for up to 2 in any combination of Pokémon SP and basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

data.name: Girafarig

attacks.name: Psybite
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Psychic Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: While it sleeps, the head of its tail keeps watch. The tail doesn't need to sleep.

data.name: Guzma
rules: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. If you do, switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Pokémon Collector
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokémon, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Professor Cozmo's Discovery
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Flip a coin. If heads, draw the bottom 3 cards of your deck. If tails, draw the top 2 cards of your deck.

data.name: Kyogre & Groudon LEGEND
rules: Put this card from your hand onto your Bench only with the other half of Kyogre & Groudon LEGEND.
When this Pokémon has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mega Tidal Wave
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards from your opponent's deck. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Energy cards you discarded to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Massive Eruption
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards from your deck. This attack does 100 damage times the number of Energy cards you discarded.

data.name: Windstorm
rules: Choose up to 2 in any combination of Pokémon Tool cards and Stadium cards in play (both yours and your opponent's) and discard them.

data.name: Dragalge

attacks.name: Poison Cultivation
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, put 10 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

data.flavorText: This vicious Pokémon sprays a poisonous liquid on opponents that come near. For whatever reason, it gets along really well with Dhelmise.

data.name: Audino

attacks.name: Do the Wave
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.

data.name: Chinchou

attacks.name: Aqua Spark
attacks.text: If Chinchou has any Water Energy attached to it, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: It discharges positive and negative electricity from its antenna tips to shock its foes.

data.name: Flabébé

abilities.name: Evolutionary Advantage
abilities.text: If you go second, this Pokémon can evolve during your first turn.

data.flavorText: When it finds a flower it likes, it dwells on that flower its whole life long. It floats in the wind's embrace with an untroubled heart.

data.name: Gabite

abilities.name: Dragon Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Dragon Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.

data.name: Mime Jr.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Mr. Mime from your hand onto Mime Jr. (this counts as evolving Mime Jr.) and remove all damage counters from Mime Jr.

attacks.name: Mime
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of cards in your opponent's hand.

data.flavorText: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokémon.

data.name: Dome Fossil
rules: Play Dome Fossil as if it were a Colorless Basic Pokémon. (Dome Fossil counts as a Trainer card as well, but if Dome Fossil is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokémon.) Dome Fossil can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Dome Fossil from play. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Rock Reaction
abilities.text: When you attach a Fighting Energy card from your hand to Dome Fossil (excluding effects of attacks or Poké-Powers), search your deck for a card that evolves from Dome Fossil and put it onto Dome Fossil (this counts as evolving Dome Fossil). Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Seeker
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Each player returns 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to it to his or her hand. (You return your Pokémon first.)

data.name: Energy Removal
rules: Choose 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and discard it.

data.name: Arcade Game
rules: Shuffle your deck, then reveal the top 3 cards of it. If at least 2 of those cards share the same name, put all the ones with that name into your hand and shuffle the rest into your deck. If none of them do, shuffle all 3 into your deck.

data.name: Charizard-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Stoke
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Rufflet

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: They will challenge anything, even strong opponents, without fear. Their frequent fights help them become stronger.

data.name: Zeraora-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Thunderclap Zone

attacks.name: Plasma Fists
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

attacks.text: Attach 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.flavorText: It emits a scent that enraptures those who smell it. This fragrance changes depending on what it has eaten.

attacks.name: Shining Arrow
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Fangs of the Sunne
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Fangs of the Sunne during your next turn.

data.flavorText: It is said to live in another world. The intense light it radiates from the surface of its body can make the darkest of nights light up like midday.

data.name: Celio's Network
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card (excluding Pokémon-ex), show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack Rhyhorn during your opponent's next turn. (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

data.flavorText: Its massive bones are 1,000 times harder than human bones. It can easily knock a trailer flying.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: Togekiss C does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Signs of Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for Silcoon and Beautifly, or Cascoon and Dustox cards. Show 1 card or both cards of a pair to your opponent and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Poison Barb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Phanpy

attacks.name: Strike Back
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is strong despite its compact size. It can easily pick up and carry an adult human on its back.

abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may discard any Stadium card in play. If you do, discard this Pokémon and all cards attached to it.

attacks.name: Red Knuckles
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Ultra Beast, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: It slips into the shadows of others and mimics their powers and movements. As it improves, it becomes stronger than those it's imitating.

data.name: Venonat

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It possesses a type of radar, which it can use to find the insects it eats for food, even in pitch darkness.

data.name: Voltorb

attacks.name: Outlet
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Bouncing Ball
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Voltorb does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch.

data.name: Vullaby
data.flavorText: They tend to guard their posteriors with suitable bones they have found. They pursue weak Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The moonlight that it stores in the wings on its back apparently gives it the ability to float in midair.

data.name: Phantump
data.flavorText: By imitating the voice of a child, it causes people to get hopelessly lost deep in the forest. It's trying to make friends with them.

data.name: Polteageist

abilities.name: Tea Break
abilities.text: You must discard a Pokémon that has the Mad Party attack from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw 2 cards.

data.flavorText: This species lives in antique teapots. Most pots are forgeries, but on rare occasions, an authentic work is found.

data.name: Slowbro Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Slowbro-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dark Raid
attacks.text: If your opponent has already used their GX attack, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.flavorText: It chases people and Pokémon from its territory by causing them to experience deep, nightmarish slumbers.

data.name: Jirachi-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Stellar Guidance

attacks.name: Hypnostrike
attacks.text: Both this Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon are now Asleep.

attacks.name: Quick Turn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

data.name: Pidgey

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

data.name: Meteor Falls
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Each player's Active Evolved Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) can use any attack from its Basic Pokémon or its Stage 1 Evolution card. (You still have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.)

data.name: Prism Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to is a Basic Pokémon, this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.

data.name: Raikou ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Lightning Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Raikou ex does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Slugma

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn't keep moving, its body will cool and harden.
